examples: The bad state of her child's health demoralizes her
The glut of oil depressed gas prices
The lack of rain had depressed the water level in the reservoir

definitions.text: lessen the activity or force of
examples: The rising inflation depressed the economy

definitions.text: flattened downward as if pressed from above or flattened along the dorsal and ventral surfaces

examples: gloomy at the thought of what he had to face
took a grim view of the economy
lonely and blue in a strange city
depressed by the loss of his job
a dispirited and resigned expression on her face
